com.yourkit.api
Class Controller

java.lang.Object
  com.yourkit.api.Controller
public final class Controller
extends java.lang.Object

The class provides API to control profiling of Java applications.

Constructor Summary

          Creates a contoller to profile application itself, i.e. to profile the JVM running the code that invokes this constructor.

Constructor Detail

Controller

public Controller()
           throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a contoller to profile application itself, i.e. to profile the JVM running the code that invokes this constructor. Application should be launched with profiler agent; see Help topic "Running applications with profiler" for details.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if application is not launched with profiler agent
See Also:
Controller(String, int)

Controller

public Controller(java.lang.String host,
                  int port)
Creates a contoller to profile remote application given host it is running and the port its profiler agent listens to. Note that the constructor does not immediately connect to the remote application. Instead, connections are established when Controller methods are invoked.

Parameters:
host - name of host where application being profiled is running. Cannot be null.
port - port profiler agent listens on. Must be in range 1-65535.
See Also:
Controller()
Method Detail

captureMemorySnapshot

public java.lang.String captureMemorySnapshot(java.lang.String snapshotFileNamePrefix,
                                              boolean continueAllocationRecording)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
Captures memory snapshot. Returns name of the snapshot file or throws exception if capture failed. Note that if an remote application is profiled (see Controller(String, int)), the returned file name will be in the file system of the remote host.

Parameters:
snapshotFileNamePrefix - will be used to form the snapshot file name. If the file with name snapshotFileNamePrefix + ".memory" does not exist, it will be created and used to save snapshot. Otherwise profiler agent will try to create files with names snapshotFileNamePrefix + "(1).memory", then snapshotFileNamePrefix + "(2).memory", etc. If snapshotFileNamePrefix is an empty string or null, timestamp-based prefix will be used. Snapshots files are created in local file system of host in the System.getProperty("user.home") directory, unless agent is configured to use alternative directory.
continueAllocationRecording - if object allocations are recorded, defines whether profiler should continue record allocations or not.
Returns:
file name of the captured snapshot
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if capture failed. The possible reasons are:
  • there's no Java application with properly configured profiler agent listening on port at host
  • agent cannot capture snapshot for some reason

captureMemorySnapshot

public java.lang.String captureMemorySnapshot(java.lang.String host,
                                              int port,
                                              java.lang.String snapshotFileNamePrefix,
                                              boolean continueAllocationRecording)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
Deprecated. Use Controller(String, int) and captureMemorySnapshot(String, boolean) instead

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

captureCPUSnapshot

public java.lang.String captureCPUSnapshot(java.lang.String snapshotFileNamePrefix,
                                           boolean continueCPUProfiling)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
Captures CPU snapshot. Returns name of the snapshot file or throws exception if capture failed. CPU sampling or CPU tracing should be already started when this method is invoked. Note that if an remote application is profiled (see Controller(String, int)), the returned file name will be in the file system of the remote host.

Parameters:
snapshotFileNamePrefix - will be used to form the snapshot file name. If the file with name snapshotFileNamePrefix + ".cpu" does not exist, it will be created and used to save snapshot. Otherwise profiler agent will try to create files with names snapshotFileNamePrefix + "(1).cpu", then snapshotFileNamePrefix + "(2).cpu", etc. If snapshotFileNamePrefix is an empty string or null, timestamp-based prefix will be used. Snapshots files are created in local file system of host in the System.getProperty("user.home") directory, unless agent is configured to use alternative directory.
continueCPUProfiling - if false CPU profiling will be stopped after snapshot creation
Returns:
file name of the captured snapshot
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if capture failed. The possible reasons are:
  • there's no Java application with properly configured profiler agent listening on port at host
  • CPU profiling is not started
  • agent cannot capture snapshot for some reason

captureCPUSnapshot

forceGC

public long[] forceGC()
               throws java.lang.Exception
Returns:
array of 2 elements: [0] - size of objects in heap before GC, bytes, [1] - size of objects in heap after GC, bytes

java.lang.Exception
